results.name: a(n) is the smallest positive integer of the form n*k/(n+k).
comment: Or, smallest b such that 1/n + 1/c = 1/b has integer solutions.
a(n) = smallest k such that k*n/(k-n) is an integer. - _Derek Orr_, May 29 2014
link: Harry J. Smith, Table of n, a(n) for n = 2..1000
formula: If n is prime a(n) = n - 1. - _Benoit Cloitre_, Dec 31 2001
example: a(6) = 2 because 6*3/(6+3) = 2 is the smallest integer of the form 6*k/(6+k).
program: (PARI) a(n)={my(k=1); if(n>1, while (n*k%(n + k), k++); n*k/(n + k))} \\ _Harry J. Smith_, Aug 20 2009
